Text.Value: What's not to like? We kill some horrible beastie, and I get what I want in return. Everyone's happy.
Getting warmer, warmer, hot.
Deal - we'll help you, if you help Astarion.
Given your appalling behaviour when we last met, I really shouldn't be helping you. But I can't resist. You're just so fascinating.
And it's all for a good cause - me.
Its actors dwell there still, mired in the languor of their long-tired scenes.
Then we have an understanding. I look forward to our next meeting.
A new grave they dug, which he himself fed.
A new grave they dug, which she herself fed.
A new grave they dug, which they themselves fed.
Don't pout, spawn. Just destroy the beast and I'll happily reveal your secrets instead of your skin.
I always knew you're a coward at heart.
Intrepid as ever.
You're welcome to give it your best shot, of course. It's just that, well, the man has proven to be more or less resilient to death.
Spell. It. Out.
Let's not be so hasty - we might enjoy doing the devil's dirty work.
Speaking of my tale, I do have one thing to ask you. A proposal of sorts.
Really? That is suspiciously fair.
Then we have an understanding. I look forward to our next meeting.
It would be pointless of me to try to bar you from entering, but I can... set the scene as it were. Prepare you for your role.
I - perhaps I should have, but I'm not used to asking for help and being met with, well... help.
Chances are many more graves than yours alone will soon be fed.
How do you even know there's danger ahead?
I already did. If through the dark you go creeping and awake what is sleeping...
Sounds like an acquaintance I'd quite like to make actually.
Did you now? And what danger would that be?
It's something of great importance to your master. But is it a love letter, a warning, or a deed of ownership? I can give you all the gory details.
Hardly, this is something else entirely.
You're a terrible poet.
Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: To Astarion. Raphael disappears if it's the end of the dialogue.

Text.Value: You have it in you to author a thrilling finale, if... if you heed this warning:
If you, however, through the dark go creeping and awake what is sleeping...
Paint me a clearer picture than that.
I had an inkling that was one of your main motivators. Delighted to see it confirmed.
All I know is you have us doing odd jobs for a devil.
Well. Now you know.
Should it make its way out through the very doors you are about to brazenly swing open, you'll have unleashed a pestilence upon this realm.
My dear friend, I think you'll find I play my part in many a plot indeed.
Let's just go. Standing here chatting gets us nowhere.
Cannot the same be said for you these days, True Soul?
Except the beastie.
Until then - adieu.
There is a stage down in the dark upon which a great drama has suspended itself in time.
I'd never think us allies, oathbreaker. Perish the thought - and the devil too, if you'd be so kind.
I'd never think us allies, paladin. Perish the thought - and the devil too, if you'd be so kind.
I'm a mentor, not your mother. I don't wax poetic about boogeymen to keep you on the straight and narrow.
I'll consider my actions when I get there.
Anything else I need to know?
Are you afraid of this creature, Raphael?
Why not let them see? Don't be shy.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

Text.Value: Do not underestimate this opponent. At best you will have the blink of an eye to strike.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) He leans in and suddenly any trace of playfulness or sarcasm has drained from his voice. In this very moment he’s dead serious.

Text.Value: What are we talking here? Lemure? Pit fiend? Orthon?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see Raphael casually leaning against a large tomb very near to the Thorm family catacombs entrance. When he sees us , he stands normally, smiles and greets us theatrically with a limerick.

Text.Value: After all, if there is one rule I hold dear, it's that one must always give the devil his due.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) He steps back and his more casual, more sarcastic self returns, in contrast with the earlier two nodes.

Text.Value: There is a creature that lurks in silence and shadow - a creature who, like me, is very much of the infernal persuasion.
Which is not the only obstacle you're likely to face...
A fairer deal than I expected.
Before you go - what can you tell me about the Infernal scars on my back?
What do you think, Astarion?
Enough of your jibber-jabber. Begone.
And I will - once the beast that lurks below is vanquished, and sent back to the Hells.
I've grown quite fond of you, you know - in my way. I thought it only fair to warn you about the dangers ahead.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) When he says ‘the dangers ahead’ he gestures generally behind him, towards the entrance of the Thorm family catacombs.

Text.Value: Gods damn it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Fed up with this shit (a devil just magicked away your shirt.)

Text.Value: What are we talking here? Lemure? Pit fiend? Orthon?
Believe me, I am not telling you half of what I know.
This creature and I go back a long way. I admit it would be in my best interest as well should it remain trapped in the dark, or misplace its head perhaps.
A warning, no less. Don't tell me you're worried about me.
You wound me, spawn. I always deal fairly.
Cazador worked on it from dusk until dawn, all with an ancient blade he called his 'needle'. Cutting and tearing, starting over if I screamed or winced too much.
By all means, stray. Explore. Hunt. Just don't indulge in the illusion that you're the greater hunter.
You haven't told them? And you've kept your clothes on this whole time? How unlike you.
A proposal? If you're hoping to taste my blood, little vampling, think again. It burns hotter than Wyvern Whiskey.
This is no night you can sleepwalk through, somnambulist, you must be wide, wide awake to survive.
It was a rough night.
Merely protecting my assets.
My old - well, a long time ago someone carved some runes into my back. I'd rather like to know what they say.

EditorData.NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

Text.Value: Gods... the carving must have been excruciating.
Fair enough.
We're not doing your dirty work, Raphael.
Very well.
Although I should probably get dressed first...

Through the dark he went creeping,
And awoke what was sleeping...

Through the dark she went creeping,
And awoke what was sleeping...

Through the dark they went creeping,
And awoke what was sleeping...
Ah, greed. My favourite virtue.
How long have you been standing around practicing that little recital?
Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: To Astarion. Raphael disappears if it's the end of the dialogue.

Text.Value: I'll deal with this menace, but do not think us allies, fiend.
Strike first. Strike true. Defy the odds, for they are distinctly in its favour. That much I owe the bastard to concede.
Long ago, some Infernal runes were cut into my back. I'd rather like to know what they say.
All right, a different question - can you tell me what the Infernal scars on my back mean?
What are you talking about, Astarion? What scars?
Yes, fine, we'll kill this damn creature of yours.
And we'll close this particular deal soon enough - vanquish the beast, and all will be revealed.
Don't be absurd.
This is serious business, devil.
And once the deed is done, our next meeting will be most productive, Astarion.
I should not relish its reacquaintance. Let's leave it at that.
But what's done is done, so how about we stop discussing it and just kill this beast?
And don't think I've forgotten your tale, Astarion.
Listen to your friend. What I'm asking isn't unreasonable - when you meet the beast, you'll realise that killing it is the wisest course.
I admit, it isn't my primary interest. Not by any stretch.
Go on then. Spit it out.
Until it was perfect.
As you wish.
What dangers are those?
It could be infinitely worse. We seem to be rather good at killing things.
I can handle myself, Raphael.
I'm not afraid of the dark.
Decorum, Karlach. A modicum, I beg of you. Especially considering what awaits you.
Why didn't you tell me earlier?
Ooh, spooky.
So you expect me to turn and walk away?
Wait! Before you go, I have a proposal of my own.
On the other hand, the enemy of my enemy etcetera.
So indulge me. And I'll indulge you.
I know my role even if you don't: it is to kill Ketheric.
I'll be pleased to follow up on your little escapades in your camp one of these nights. Should you live to tell your tale, that is.

Our hero thought but of treasure ahead,
Did not consider the peace of the dead...
When the beast is dead, I'll consider that payment enough to translate those scars of yours.
Fine, paint me a picture.
In truth, it is carnage incarnate. So if you meet the devil of which I speak, kill it. Consider no other course of action.
You're still only telling me half of what you really know. I can tell.
Just cut to the chase, will you.
I'd rather you stick to my script, but you do have an unfortunate tendency to improvise.
Oh, we both know they are soon to be revealed.
Are you saying there's treasure ahead?
Listen here, pipsqueak.
How long were you skulking there, practicing that rhyme before I arrived?

Synopsis:
Raphael is encountered at the beginning of the Shar Temple. He briefs the player about the Orthon - the devil he mentions - either telling them that he personally wants it dead, or that it is between the player and their objective. He then saves them from a trap and warns them about the dangers of the temple, before vanishing.

!!! Don't remove REALLY_ASTARION tag check from the OOM branch!!!
